RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ARIKARA broke sharply and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backside while racing out from the rail, opened a clear advantage through the final turn, and widened her margin late to prove best. HARLAN'S ANGEL away well and pressed the pacesetter three wide entering the backside, struggled to keep tabs on the leader while racing three wide into the final turn, and closed willingly two wide in the drive to hold the place. PINEAPPLE TIDBITS tracked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside through the final turn, and finished willingly from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. JERSEY LILLIE away alertly and tracked the leaders in the run down the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, rallied two wide through the final turn but failed to mount a serious late bid while finishing four wide in the drive. IMA DAREDEVIL trailed the field into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but was unable to make a late impact while finishing four out from the rail in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Pineapple Tidbits
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Arikara
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, led rail, rallied 2 wide, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Harlan's Angel
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, pressed 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Jersey Lillie
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, tracked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ima Daredevil
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 11000. (PLUS UP TO $5,500 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JANUARY 23 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 22 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000, For Each $500 To $3,000 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: QUAGMIRE away alertly and raced to the lead while racing one out from the rail entering the first turn, dictated the pace in the run down the backside while racing out from the rail, increased his advantage through the final turn, and widened that margin through the lane while confidently handled. RING OF KERRY broke sharply and tracked the leader into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, commenced his bid from along the inside entering the final turn, and closed willingly two wide in the drive to hold the place. KNOPFLER away well and stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing one out from the rail, tipped three wide soon after entering the backstretch and was asked to creep closer, rallied three wide through the final turn, and finished determinedly two out from the rail in the drive to garner a share. I'M A CHI TOO was taken in hand soon after the start, and dropped back to trail, well behind the field, launched his bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished two wide in the drive while only able to pass a tiring rival. DRILLER tracked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded in the late stages.

ENTRY.NAME: I'm a Chi Too
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Ring of Kerry
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked rail, rallied inside, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Knopfler
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Quagmire
ENTRY.OWNER: Henson Lorie Klimes Helen and Pring Sharon
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led 2 wide, rallied inside, widened

ENTRY.NAME: Driller
ENTRY.OWNER: Danard Don B and Snow Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 74. Claiming Purse 13500. (PLUS UP TO $6,750 THRIF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $8,000, allowed 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $12,500. Races where entered for $8,000 or less not considered in Allowances.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KOALA away alertly and raced to the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, battled for the lead from the inside of QUALITY COMMAND in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, briefly appeared to be overtaken entering the lane, but fought back stubbornly from along the rail late to prevail in the final strides. QUALITY COMMAND broke sharply and tracked the leader into the first turn while racing one out from the rail, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and through the final turn, looked to take a narrow advantage into the lane, but was unable to dispose of a very game rival in the final strides to just miss. ICE BREAKER stalked the leaders in the run down the backside while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but was unable to make a late impact while finishing three wide in the drive.

ENTRY.NAME: Quality Command
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, tracked 2w, pressed 2w, closed 2w, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Ice Breaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Koala
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, closed rail, prevailed

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 89. Claiming Purse 14000. (PLUS UP TO $7,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June22 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since May 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, For Each $1,250 To $10,000 2 lbs. British Col umbia Bred Claiming Price $15,000. Races where entered for $10,000 or less not considered in Allowances.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FINDING WAYS away alertly and raced to a narrow advantage entering the first turn while saving ground at the rail, set a pressured pace from the inside of FOREIGN PROTOCOL in the run down the backstretch and into the final turn, shook clear of his pace rival midway through the final turn, and was never seriously threatened late. TIZ VICIOUS away well and stalked the leaders into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, took up the chase two wide entering the final turn, and closed willingly three wide in the drive to prove clearly second best. FOREIGN PROTOCOL rushed up from between rivals in the run to the first turn to press the pace two wide entering the turn, forced the issue two wide in the run down the backside and into the final turn, was unable to keep tabs on his pace rival leaving the turn, and finished two wide in the drive to hold on for a share. PARKER POINT was put in tight quarters passing the wire the first time, and allowed to settle off the contested early pace entering the backstretch, rallied from along the inside entering the final turn, and finished with late interest from along the rail in the drive. COUNTRY COWBOY broke sharply and was allowed to settle towards the back of the pack while racing three wide into the backstretch, rallied two wide into the final turn, but was unable to mount a serious late bid.

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz Vicious
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Finding Ways
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, led rail, rallied inside, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Parker Point
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Foreign Protocol
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 2 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Country Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, settled 3 wide, rallied 2 wide, needed more

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 5 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 88. Claiming Purse 13500. (PLUS UP TO $6,750 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 22 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, if for $8,000, allowe d 2 lbs. British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $12,500. Races where entered for $8,000 or less not considered in Allowances.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MAKEITORBREAKIT broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of LAUGH WITH me entering the stretch the first time, assumed command entering the second turn, set a pressured pace in the run down the backstretch and through the final turn, got the better of LAUGH WITH ME entering the lane, and drew clear late. LAUGH WITH ME away alertly and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, eased off his pace rival entering the second turn to take a tracking trip into the backside, forced the issue two wide through the final turn, was unable to match strides with his pace rival entering the lane, and closed two wide in the drive to prove second best. BROKE AN BROKEN ducked in at the start to get away poorly, and settled well off the early pace while racing one out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, commenced his bid from along the rail entering the final turn, and finished from along the rail in the drive to garner a share. MY COLLEGE FUND away well and tracked the leaders into the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, advanced three wide soon after entering the backside, rallied two out from the rail through the final turn, but needed more late. FAMILY BIZ unhurried early while trailing the field three wide entering the lane the first time, remained at the back of the pack in the run down the backstretch, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but failed to mount a serious late bid when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Broke an Broken
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked in start, settled 2 wide, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: My College Fund
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, tracked 2 wide, advanced 1/2, rallied 3w, hung late

ENTRY.NAME: Family Biz
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried early, trailed, rallied 3 wide, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Laugh With Me
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, vied rail, tracked 2w, rallied 2w, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Makeitorbreakit
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2w, led, rallied inside, drew clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Purse 25000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN OR CLAIMING SINCE JANUARY 23. Weight, 122 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since June 8 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since Then Allowed 4 lbs. Races where entered for $2 5,000 or less not considered in Allowances.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ABOVE AVERAGE broke sharply and stalked the leaders from along the rail through the stretch the first time, advanced smartly from along the rail midway down the backstretch, awaited room approaching the final turn, rallied smartly from along the rail through the turn, tipped two wide to quickly overhaul the pacesetter entering the lane and drew clear as much the best. ARUNDEL CASTLE settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail entering the stretch the first time, launched her bid two wide entering the final turn, and found her best stride late while finishing four wide in the drive to get up for the place. MATSQUI away well and stalked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained her position in the run down the backstretch, rallied two wide into the final turn, and closed steadily three wide in the drive to get up for a share. LICORICE away alertly and pressed the pace from the outside of HOAX into the stretch the first time, took control and raced on a clear lead in the run down the backside, rallied along the inside through the final turn, was quickly overtaken entering the lane, and gave way grudgingly late while finishing two wide in the drive. FREESTYLE settled off the early pace while racing one out from the rail through the stretch the first time, rallied four wide entering the final turn, and finished three out from the rail in the drive. FANNY BAY ALI was off awkwardly and drifted out in the opening strides while clipping heels with FREESTYLE, settled well off the early pace while racing two out from the rail entering the stretch the first time, rallied along the rail through the final turn, and finished from along the inside in the stretch drive while lacking racing room. INDYETTA tracked the leaders through the stretch the first time while racing one out from the rail, maintained a tracking trip in the run down the backside, rallied three wide entering the final turn, but faded in the lane while racing four out from the rail. HOAX set a pressured pace from along the rail entering the stretch the first time, eased into a tracking trip entering the second turn and in the run down the backside, began to weaken entering the final turn, and had nothing to offer late.

ENTRY.NAME: Arundel Castle
ENTRY.OWNER: Johnson Lyle Johnson Mark V and Harding Clive
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied 2 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Hoax
ENTRY.OWNER: Willow Creek Farms and Chiesa Fabio
ENTRY.COMMENT: led rail, rallied 2 wide, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Licorice
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, pressed 2w, clear lead, rallied inside, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Above Average
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, stalked rail, rallied inside, led, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Matsqui
ENTRY.OWNER: Renfrew Racing B and B Racing No Trump Stable Elder Matt and Breen Bill
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, stalked 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, closed 3 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Fanny Bay Ali
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward start, clip heels, settle 3w, rallied inside, closed rail

ENTRY.NAME: Freestyle
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 4 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Indyetta
ENTRY.OWNER: Albertson Brian and The Estate of Dennis Tucker
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 5 wide, faded

RACE.RACE_TEXT: HASTINGS RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 12000. (PLUS UP TO $6,000 THRIF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since June 22 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since May 22 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, For Each $625 To $5,000 2 lbs. (Races Wh ere Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility or Allowances). British Columbia Bred Claiming Price $8,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RACING RIVER away well and vied for the lead from along the rail entering the first turn, controlled the pace in the run down the backside while racing out from the rail, maintained his advantage through the final turn, and held FOOT SOLDIER safely at bay late while finishing four wide in the drive. FOOT SOLDIER away alertly and stalked the leader into the backstretch while racing two out from the rail, launched his bid three wide entering he final turn, and finished willingly four wide in the drive to get up for the place. MORETHANSOULTITLE stalked the early pace into the backstretch while saving ground at the rail, rallied along the inside through the final turn, and closed one out from the rail in the drive to just miss the place. VALUABLE COWBOY broke sharply and dueled for the lead from the outside of RACING RIVER entering the first turn, eased off that rival to gain a tracking trip entering he backstretch, rallied two wide entering the final turn, but faded in the late going. WISE MARKET settled well off the early pace while saving ground at the rail in the run down the backstretch, rallied along the inside entering the final turn, but lacked the needed closing response when called upon. DEPUTY'S DANCER settled well off the early pace while racing two wide into the backstretch, rallied one out from the rail entering the final turn, but failed to mount a late bid when called upon.

ENTRY.NAME: Racing River
ENTRY.COMMENT: away well, vied rail, led, held

ENTRY.NAME: Valuable Cowboy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, dueled 2w, tracked 2w, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Market
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled rail, rallied inside, needed more

ENTRY.NAME: Foot Soldier
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, stalked 3 wide, rallied 3 wide, closed 4 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Morethansoultitle
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside, rallied rail, closed 2 wide,

ENTRY.NAME: Deputy's Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled 2 wide, rallied 2 wide, no factor
